docs.title: Home
docs.text: Lipi is a free Punjabi learning tool.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Lipi lessons are created in json format and are comprimised of problem / page objects. These objects can be used to build a lesson.

docs.title: Types of Objects
docs.text:
• multi_choice
  • match_prob
  • laga_prob
  • word_prob
  • drag_word
  • sound_word
  • info_page
  • final_page

docs.title: Example Lesson
docs.text:
[
  {
    "type": "info_page",
    "content": [
      {
        "size": "title",
        "text": "Example Lesson"
      },
      {
        "style": "nl",
        "times": 2
      },
      {
        "size": "big",
        "text": "This is an example lesson",
        "style": "highlight"
      },
      {
        "style": "nl",
        "times": 2
      },
      {
        "text": " Click next to continue!"
      }
    ]
  },
  {
    "type": "multi_choice",
    "answer": "3",
    "options": [
      "3",
      "6",
      "2",
      "9"
    ],
    "question": "1 + 2",
    "subtitle": "Example Question"
  },
  {
    "type": "multi_choice",
    "answer": "こんにちは",
    "options": [
      "こんにちは",
      "ありがとう",
      "はい",
      "いいえ"
    ],
    "hints": [
      "Hello",
      "Thank You",
      "Yes",
      "No"
    ],
    "question": "Hello",
    "subtitle": "Translate to Japanese"
  },
  {
    "type": "word_prob",
    "word": "Hot",
    "answer": "ਗਰਮ"
  },
]

docs.title: Drag Word Problem
docs.text:
Name: "drag_word"

Template 
  {
      "type": "drag_word",
      "targets": [],
      "answer": []
  },
Template With Label 
  {
      "type": "drag_word",
      "label": "",
      "targets": [],
      "answer": []
  },

docs.title: About
docs.text: This is a problem in which you drag diffrent Punjabi characters to the "targets" in order to create a word.

docs.title: Creation
docs.text:
You create a multi choice problem by setting "type" to "drag_word". 

  {
      "type": "drag_word",
      ...
  }

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• "label" OPTIONAL
  • "targets" REQUIRED LIST
  • "answer" REQUIRED LIST

docs.title: Label
docs.text:
"label": ""

This is the label/instruction that shows up at the top of the problem. By default it is set to "Transliterate", but this can be overridden if need be.

  "label": "Translate",

Info

This property is optional and not required.

docs.title: Targets
docs.text:
"targets": []

This is a list of targets, to which the user will drag their answers.

  "targets": ["Soo", "Ra", "J"],

This will usally be the sounds of the corresponding options in the "answer" list.

docs.title: Answer
docs.text:
"answer": []

This is a list of characters, which when put together will make a word. It is split into a list because the user will drag each item sepreatly and attempt to match them to the corresponding sounds from the "targets" list.

  "answer": ["ਸੂ", "ਰ", "ਜ"]

Warning

The answer list must correspond with the "targets" in the same exact order to work correctly.

Example 
  "targets": ["Soo", "Ra", "J"],
  "answer": ["ਸੂ", "ਰ", "ਜ"]

In this case the answer for:

  • "Soo" is "ਸੂ"
  • "Ra" is "ਰ"
  • "J" is "ਜ"

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
{
    "type": "drag_word",
    "targets": ["Soo", "Ra", "J"],
    "answer": ["ਸੂ", "ਰ", "ਜ"]
  },
Example With Label 
  {
    "type": "drag_word",
    "label": "Sound",
    "targets": ["Soo", "Ra", "J"],
    "answer": ["ਸੂ", "ਰ", "ਜ"]
  },

docs.title: Laga Problem
docs.text:
Name: "multi_choice"

Template 
  {
    "type": "laga_prob",
    "prompt": "",
    "start_text": "",
    "answer": ""
  }

docs.title: Creation
docs.text:
You create a laga problem by setting "type" to "laga_prob". 

  {
      "type": "laga_prob",
      ...
  }

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• "prompt" REQUIRED
  • "start_text" REQUIRED
  • "options" OPTIONAL LIST
  • "hints" OPTIONAL BOOLEAN
  • "answer" REQUIRED

docs.title: Prompt
docs.text:
"prompt": ""

This is the instruction that will be shown to the user.

  "prompt": "Make the Chaa sound",

Tipically a prompt will just ask the user to make a certian sound.

docs.title: Start Text
docs.text:
"start_text": ""

This is the text that the preview starts off as. This is typically a character in which the user will add a laga from one of the "options" in order to make the sound given in the "prompt".

  "start_text": "ਚ",

In this case the user will add a laga from the "options" to the ਚ character to make the sound given in the prompt.

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
"options": [6]

This is a list of laga that the user can add onto the "start_text" in order to make the sound in the "prompt". The list of options must contain at least and at most 6 laga. This is property is OPTIONAL and is not required in order for the problem to work.

  "options": ["ਾ", "ਿ", "ੀ", "ੁ", "ੂ", "ੈ"],

Warning

The laga used in the "answer" must be provided in the list of options!

Not Required

Lipi has updated and no longer REQUIRES a list of options. Lipi can now genarate a random list of options given the "answer" property. You can still provide a list of options, Lipi will use the provided "options" if they are given. If not Lipi will randomly generate new options.

docs.title: Hints
docs.text:
"hints": false

Weather or not to show hints under the laga. The hints would show what sound the laga (or that option) makes. For example the laga ਾ would have the hint Aa as it makes the Aa sound.

  "hints": true,
Info

Used to be a list full of hints for the options much like in the multi choice problem, but since the option auto generation update it has been changed to a boolean.

docs.title: Answer
docs.text:
"answer": ""

This is the answer of the question. It should contain the "start_text" along with the laga attached, so that makes the sound specified in the "prompt".

  "answer": "ਚਾ"
This makes the Chaa sound so this is the answer. The user would essentially create this using the givin options. If the user chooses the "ਾ" option they can get the correct answer.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
{
    "type": "laga_prob",
    "prompt": "Make the Chaa sound",
    "start_text": "ਚ",
    "answer": "ਚਾ"
  },
Example With Options 
{
  "type": "laga_prob",
  "prompt": "Make the Chaa sound",
  "start_text": "ਚ",
  "options": ["ਾ", "ਿ", "ੀ", "ੁ", "ੂ", "ੈ"],
  "answer": "ਚਾ"
},
Example With Hints 
{
  "type": "laga_prob",
  "prompt": "Make the Chaa sound",
  "start_text": "ਚ",
  "hints": true,
  "answer": "ਚਾ"
},

docs.title: Matching Problem
docs.text:
Name: "match_prob"

Template 
  {
    "type": "match_prob",
    "answer_key": {
        "": "",
        "": "",
        "": "",
        "": ""
    }
  }

docs.title: Creation
docs.text:
You create a match problem by setting "type" to "match_prob". 

  {
      "type": "match_prob",
      ...
  }

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: • "answer_key" REQUIRED DICTIONARY

docs.title: Answer Key
docs.text:
"answer_key": {}

The "answer_key" property is a dictionary which contains key value pairs that match.

  "answer_key": {
      "One": "1",
      "Two": "2",
      "Four": "4",
      "Three": "3"
  }
In this case we can see that "One" matches "1" so if the user clicked on "One" and matched it with "1", Then that would be correct! On the other hand if they tried to match "One" with "3" that would be wrong!

Note

You do not have to worry about scrambling just make sure the key value pairs match, and Lipi will do the scrambling for you.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
{
    "type": "match_prob",
    "answer_key": {
      "One": "1",
      "Two": "2",
      "Four": "4",
      "Three": "3"
    }
  }

docs.title: Multiple Choice
docs.text:
Name: "multi_choice"

Template 
  {
      "type": "multi_choice",
      "subtitle": "",
      "question": "",
      "options": ["", "", "", ""],
      "hints": ["", "", "", ""],
      "answer": ""
  },

docs.title: Creation
docs.text:
You create a multi choice problem by setting "type" to "multi_choice". 

  {
      "type": "multi_choice",
      ...
  }

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• "question" REQUIRED
  • "subtitle" REQUIRED
  • "options" REQUIRED LIST
  • "hints" OPTIONAL LIST
  • "answer" REQUIRED
  • "answerText" OPTIONAL

docs.title: Question
docs.text:
"question": ""

This is what will be shown to the user. 

  "question": "ਚ",

This will usally be a character or word in which the user has to translate.

docs.title: Subtitle
docs.text:
"subtitle": ""

This is a subtitle shown under the question to let the user know what kind of problem it is. Example: "Translate" or "Sound". 

  "subtitle": "Sound",

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
"options": []

This is a list of multiple options from which the user may pick to answer the question.

  "options": ["Cha", "Ma", "Ra", "La"],

Warning

One of the "options" must must be EXACTLY the same as the "answer" property, in order for it to function correctly.

docs.title: Hints
docs.text:
"hints": []

This is a list of hints that show up directly below the options. These hints are used to guide the user to the right answer when it's something hard, or somthing they might not know yet.

  "hints": ["ਚ", "ਮ", "ਰ", "ਲ"]

Note

The "hints" list must be in EXACTLY the same order as their corresponding option in the "options" list.

Example 
  "options": ["Cha", "Ma", "Ra", "La"],
  "hints": ["ਚ", "ਮ", "ਰ", "ਲ"],
  • ਚ is the hint for Cha
  • ਮ is the hint for Ma
  • Etc...

docs.title: Answer
docs.text:
"answer": ""

This is the answer of the question.

  "answer": "Cha",

The correct answer from the "options" list.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
{
    "type": "multi_choice",
    "subtitle": "Sound",
    "question": "ਚ",
    "options": ["Cha", "Ma", "Ra", "La"],
    "answer": "Cha",
    "answerText": "Cha (ਚ)"
  },
Example With Hints 
  {
    "type": "multi_choice",
    "subtitle": "Sound",
    "question": "ਚ",
    "options": ["Cha", "Ma", "Ra", "La"],
    "hints": ["ਚ", "ਮ", "ਰ", "ਲ"],
    "answer": "Cha",
    "answerText": "Cha (ਚ)"
  },

docs.title: Review Problem
docs.text:
Name: "review"

Template 
  {
      "type": "review",
      "chapter": // (1)!
  },
  1. Add an integer value of the chapter you would like to pull the review question from here.

docs.title: About
docs.text: The review object pulls a random problem from the specified "chapter" property.

docs.title: Creation
docs.text:
You create a multi choice problem by setting "type" to "review". 

  {
      "type": "review",
      ...
  }

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: • "chapter" REQUIRED INTEGER

docs.title: Chapter
docs.text:
"chapter":

This is the chapter you want to get the problem from.

  "chapter": 3

This would get a random problem from chapter 3

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
{
    "type": "review",
    "chapter": 3
  },

  {
    "type": "review",
    "chapter": 4
  },

docs.title: Sound Word Problem
docs.text:
Name: "sound_word"

Template 
  {
    "type": "sound_word",
    "word": ""
  },
Template With Options 
  {
    "type": "sound_word",
    "word": "",
    "options": ["", "", "", ""]
  },

docs.title: Creation
docs.text:
You create a multi choice problem by setting "type" to "sound_word". 

  {
      "type": "sound_word",
      ...
  }

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• "word" REQUIRED
  • "options" OPTIONAL LIST

docs.title: Word
docs.text:
"word": ""

This is the Punjabi word who's sound will be used for this problem. The sound of this word will be played to the user and the user will have find the right word from the "options" list.

  "word": "ਸਚ",

In this case Lipi will fetch the sound for the word "ਸਚ" and play it to the user.

Warning

In order for Lipi to be able to play the sound of the word, the word needs to be in the Lipi online storage! (1)

  1. In otherwords it needs to be in the Supabase storage.

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
"options": []

This is a list of multiple options from which the user may pick to answer the question. Make sure to add the word from the "word" property as one of the options!

  "options": ["ਸਚ", "ਮਿਰਚ", "ਖਾਲੀ", "ਕੇਲਾ"],

Warning

One of the "options" must must be EXACTLY the same as the "word" property, in order for it to function correctly.

Not Reqired

The "options" property is not required. Lipi will automatically generate a list of random words if the "options" property is not given!

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
{
    "type": "sound_word",
    "word": "ਸਚ"
  },
Example With Options 
  {
    "type": "sound_word",
    "options": ["ਸਚ", "ਮਿਰਚ", "ਖਾਲੀ", "ਕੇਲਾ"],
    "word": "ਸਚ"
  },

docs.title: Word Problem
docs.text:
Name: "word_prob"

Template 
  {
    "type": "word_prob",
    "word": "",
    "answer": ""
  },

docs.title: About
docs.text: This is a typing word problem in which the user is usally tasked with translating the given "word" into a Punjabi word.

docs.title: Creation
docs.text:
You create a multi choice problem by setting "type" to "word_prob". 

  {
      "type": "word_prob",
      ...
  }

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• "word" REQUIRED
  • "answer" REQUIRED

docs.title: Word
docs.text:
"word": ""

This is the English verion of the word. This is the word that the user needs to translate.

  "word": "King",

docs.title: Answer
docs.text:
"answer": ""

This is the translated version of the "word".

  "answer": "ਰਾਜਾ",

Info

Lipi automatically creates a keyboard the user can use to type out the answer, which is why this problem only reqiures the "word" and "answer".

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
{
    "type": "word_prob",
    "word": "King",
    "answer": "ਰਾਜਾ"
  },
